H0.text: Day can become night because the Earth is tilted 23.5° on its axis, as Dan knows.

H1.text: Different seasons occur because the Earth is tilted 23.5° on its axis, as Dan knows.

H2.text: Low tide can become high tide is caused by Earth's 23.5° axial tilt.

H3.text: The change in phases of the Moon is caused by Earth's axial tilt of 23.5°.

A4.text: This causes one pole to be pointed more toward the Sun on one side of the orbit, and more away from the Sun on the other side—the cause of the seasons on Earth.

A5.text: This is the cause of Earth's seasons.
